main event: On January 25, 1951, a civilian observer reported a sighting of an unidentified flying object near Warner Robins AFB, Georgia.
interesting points: The object was described as a cone shape with a steady red glow, approximately 3/4 the size of a full moon, and was estimated to be moving at 3600 mph., The object was observed for a duration of 3 minutes before disappearing from view., Multiple witnesses, including a pilot and a family, reported seeing the object, each with slightly different descriptions of its appearance., The weather conditions at the time were clear, with visibility of 10 miles., The object was initially thought to be a burning plane, but no smoke or noise was observed.
witness description: Civilians including a pilot and his family
